title.narrative: VIOLENCE PREVENTION AND RIGHTS PROMOTION

description.narrative: 3.1. Public opinion and families have increased awareness to provide a responsive, nurturing and safe environment and to change negative practices to prevent violence, maltreatment or neglect., which contributes to Access To Justice, Child Protection â€“ Strengthen Families And Communities, Data And Child Protection, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid), Violence, Exploitation And Abuse. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged, benefit from a violence-free environment, a child protection system that guarantees a quality and appropriate response, and a juvenile justice system in compliance with international standards.

related-activity.ref: 0240/A0/05/883 PR 3: PROTECTION & JUSTICE FOR CHILD & A

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.1. Public opinion and families have increased awareness to provide a responsive, nurturing and safe environment and to changenegative practices to prevent violence, maltreatment or neglect.

description.narrative: During this period, UNICEF has achieved significant results to prevent maltreatment, sexual abuse and gender-based violence (GVB) and to guarantee access to justice for children and adolescents. This included support to national and provincial initiatives to prevent violence in early childhood, strengthen parental skills and promoting an inter-sectoral approach to guarantee protection and response for VAC with focus on sexual abuse and non-intended pregnancy. In addition, UNICEF contributed to raise awareness and generate evidence and information about VAC and GBV to increase the reporting of cases to the specialized services. | Status:Met | As-of Date:18/08/2021
